description: {"blocks":[{"key":"ctjsf","text":"The Thermo Scientific HisPur Ni-NTA Resin enables effective immobilized metal affinity chromatography (IMAC) purification of polyhistidine-tagged proteins from a soluble protein extract. This resin is composed of nickel-charged nitrilotriacetic acid (NTA) chelate immobilized onto 6% crosslinked agarose. The Ni-NTA resin is compatible with native or denaturing conditions and can be used in multiple formats, including conventional gravity-flow chromatography, spin column and FPLC. Ni-NTA resins are commonly chosen for His-tagged-protein purification because of the four metal-binding sites on the chelate, which allow for high-binding capacity and low-metal ion leaching.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"eb28l","text":"Important Product Information","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":29}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"84ies","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"860n1","text":" • Protein yield and purity are dependent upon the expression level, conformation and solubility characteristics of the recombinant fusion protein. Therefore, it is important to optimize these parameters before attempting a large-scale purification. For best results, perform a small-scale test to estimate the expression level and determine the solubility of each His-tagged protein. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"7ih8s","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"4lraa","text":"• Optimization of the lysis procedure is critical for maximizing protein yield. Some methods for protein extraction include using B-PER Bacterial Protein Extraction Reagent, mechanical methods such as freeze/thaw cycles, sonication or French press. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"9gil5","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"96hkf","text":"• Sometimes overexpressed proteins are sequestered in inclusion bodies. Inclusion bodies of His-tagged proteins can be solubilized in 8M urea, 6M guanidine) and purified with the Ni-NTA resin, but a denaturant must be added to buffers so the protein remains soluble throughout the procedure. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"aa266","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"drnqf","text":"• These instructions are effective for many types of samples; however, optimization might be required to further reduce nonspecific binding. To optimize conditions, adjust the recommended imidazole concentration in the Equilibration, Wash and Elution Buffer. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"9qqrb","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"6h88g","text":"• Avoid using protease inhibitors or other additives that contain chelators, such as EDTA, or strong reducing agents, such as DTT or β-mercaptoethanol, which will disrupt the function of the nickel resin. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"12k1r","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"a8ltq","text":"• When using the Bradford Assay to monitor protein concentration in the elution fractions, dilute the samples at least 1:2 before performing the protein assay.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
materials_text: {"blocks":[{"key":"8qpps","text":"For native conditions prepare the following buffers: ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":53}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"6a6er","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"13pnt","text":"• Equilibration Buffer: 20mM sodium phosphate, 300mM sodium chloride (PBS) with 10mM imidazole; pH 7.4 ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"cf8jf","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"fb993","text":"• Wash Buffer: PBS with 25mM imidazole; pH 7.4 ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"b2hsp","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"4n7k0","text":"• Elution Buffer: PBS with 250mM imidazole; pH 7.4 ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"2b1o4","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"1r069","text":"For denaturing conditions prepare the following buffers: ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":57}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"8gk10","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"3n6tl","text":"• Equilibration Buffer: PBS with 6M guanidine•HCl and 10mM imidazole; pH 7.4 ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"2iok","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"a4bk6","text":"• Wash Buffer: PBS with 6M guanidine•HCl and 25mM imidazole; pH 7.4 ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"6veqc","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"4s7ck","text":"• Elution Buffer: PBS with 6M guanidine•HCl and 250mM imidazole; pH 7.4 ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"cfctj","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"e4aqi","text":"For resin regeneration prepare the following buffer: ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":53}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"3mh3","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"fd1c3","text":"• MES Buffer: 20mM 2-(N-morpholine)-ethanesulfonic acid, 0.1M sodium chloride; pH 5.0","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"a8p4h","text":"Add   of a 50% Ni-NTA resinslurry to a 1.7 ml microcentrifuge tube. Centrifuge tube for   at 700 × g and carefully remove and discard the supernatant.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":4,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":88,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"pcf9","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"5c6da","text":"","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"40bf2","text":"","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"8k9tc","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"250","guid":"0EA76050F90E11EAAB7A85CD3C1536AE","id":0,"label":"","unit":1}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"","data":{"duration":120,"guid":"28F25550F90E11EAAB7A85CD3C1536AE","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"2":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"ad1ag","text":"The HisPur Ni-NTA Resin allows for purification strategy customization. Purification conditions can be scaled as needed. The procedure may be performed at room temperature or at 4°C.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"4jt54","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"2g6bn","text":"It is important to spin the resin only at speeds up to 700 x g","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"4tbh","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"3gr8c","text":"You should only use a 1 ml pipette tip when manipulating the resin.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dkt8u","text":"Add two resin-bed volumes of Equilibration Buffer and mix gently until the resin is fully resuspended","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"81fju","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"2bem0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"length":1,"offset":16},{"key":1,"length":1,"offset":81}],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"7ucvj","text":"Since you added   of the 50% resin slurry to your tube, your resin bed volume is  ","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"52kv5","text":"","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{"0":{"data":{"amount":"250","guid":"516C4590F90E11EAAB7A85CD3C1536AE","id":0,"label":"","unit":1},"mutability":"","type":"amount"},"1":{"data":{"amount":"125","guid":"53DD1E80F90E11EAAB7A85CD3C1536AE","id":0,"label":"","unit":1},"mutability":"","type":"amount"}}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3to7j","text":"Centrifuge tube for   at 700 × g and carefully remove and discard buffer.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":20,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"enb4t","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"","data":{"duration":120,"guid":"9249F440F90E11EAAB7A85CD3C1536AE","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"63guq","text":"Prepare sample by mixing the protein extract from your B-PER Lysis with an equal volume of Equilibration Buffer. The total volume should equal at least two volumes of the resin bed.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5i90n","text":"Add the prepared protein extract to the tube and mix on an end-over-end rotator for 30 minutes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4c2d6","text":"Centrifuge the tube for   at 700 × g. If desired, save supernatant for downstream analysis.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":24,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"15ihj","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"","data":{"duration":120,"guid":"A7F26340F90E11EAAB7A85CD3C1536AE","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"at5b","text":"Wash the resin with two resin-bed volumes of Wash Buffer. Centrifuge the tube for   at 700 × g. Save supernatant for downstream analysis.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":82,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"30kfs","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"","data":{"duration":120,"guid":"AF2A6130F90E11EAAB7A85CD3C1536AE","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ff6qv","text":"Repeat wash step. Optional: You can monitor the washing by measuring the absorbance of the supernatant by  at 280 nm until a baseline is reached.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8drhd","text":"Elute bound His-tagged proteins using one resin-bed volume of Elution Buffer. Centrifuge tube for   at 700 × g. Carefully remove and save the supernatant. Repeat this step twice, saving each supernatant fraction in a separate tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":98,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"1qudt","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"","data":{"duration":120,"guid":"EA38C9B0F90E11EAAB7A85CD3C1536AE","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"c8vdd","text":"Monitor protein elution by measuring the absorbance of the fractions at 280nm. Since you are purifying a fluorescent protein, you can also monitor the protein concentration by measuring the absorbance at 500 nm. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"43qc7","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"fopkp","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"ac7vo","text":"The eluted protein can be directly analyzed by SDS-PAGE. Samples containing 6M guanidine•HCl must be dialyzed against a buffer containing 8M urea before SDS-PAGE analysis.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

title: HisPur Purification of His-Tagged Proteins--CHEM 584
